lines.text: Remember when we were kids and I run you over with my bicycle?
Yes.
I have a car now.
Alex is reading me "Robin Hood," where he robs from the poor and gives to the rich.
That's not Robin Hood, that's Ronald Reagan.
Dad, Alex, this is Jamie Carter.
Aaaaah!
[jumps into his father's arms]
It's okay, Alex. She said Jamie, not Jimmy.
People who have money don't need people.

[walks into the kitchen]
What's this?
Andrew drew it. It's a picture of a dog. I told him that he couldn't have a dog because Mallory is allergic to dogs.
What's this?
It's a picture of Mallory moving away.
Hey, I don't mind if I toot my own horn. Toot, toot!
I can't wait to try this Pasta Alex, Alex.
[Speaks with womanly voice]
I love a man with a healthy appetite.
[Uncle Ned is an alcoholic]
You just drank a whole bottle of vanilla extract.
I'm sorry; did you want some?

[after Nick makes Andy a dream hat, to help him go to sleep]
I had not idea Nick could be so... useful.
[drunken Ned throws newspaper clipping in the fireplace]
Hey, don't do that. Here give me those.
Leave me alone!
Give me those!

[screaming]
LEAVE ME ALONE!
[slaps Alex]
What the hell are you doing?
I don't know. I don't know. I'm sorry. Sorry, Alex.
[Ned cries]

[quietly, but furious]
All right, Ned. That's it. It's over. Right now, either you get some help... or you get the hell outta my house.

[panic-stricken]
The light bulb is out in my bedroom! What are we going to do?
Mom, I need to reevaluate my life. Do you have a minute?

[Referring to a current infatuation]
Of all the Basic Applied Economic Principles of Capitalism in the Post-Industrial Era Seminars in the world, you had to walk into mine.
[about his new boss, Rebecca Ryan]
Face it, Keaton. She wants you.
Don't you remember? We said we were going to be creative this year and make gifts instead of spending a lot of money Christmas shopping.
Well, I know we said it, I just didn't know we meant it.
Alex is King!

[Mallory scored higher than Alex on an IQ test]
I want you, Mallory! I want you! I can take you with one brain tied behind my back!
Mallory, someone stupid called... sometime today... about something trivial.
Alex you know that could be any one of my friends.
Alex was offended by our political magazines and ripped them up.
You have no proof.
Yes we do. We found your rattle on the floor next to the evidence.
It could have Mallory's.
It was your Nixon rattle.
It's just like taking candy from a baby.
Brings back memories.
We can walk on coals / Have ninjas fight us / Just don't get gingivitis.

[later as he's sleeping]
We can walk on coals / Have ninjas fight us/ Just don't get gingivitis.
[wakes up]
Elyse, I had a nightmare. I dreamed I was Nick.
I shop, therefore I am.

[reading from a card given to him by Alex]
"Alex is more than a son. He's a companion, a friend, whom I can spend many long hours with discussing the economy, world events and politics." Alex, if I read this out loud, I'm afraid I'll be struck by lightning.
[Alex nods towards Elyse]

[reading from her card]
Mom, please read the "Alex is more than a son" speech, if dad refuses.
I love you, Elyse.
No, I love you more, Steven.
[Elyse and Steven make kissy noises through the telephone]

[shouting from upstairs]
Oh, for crying... will you hang up the phone?

[walks into the kitchen]
What's this?
Andrew drew it. It's a picture of a dog. I told him that he couldn't have a dog because Malory is allergic to dogs.
What's this?
It's a picture of Malory moving away.
The meaning of life? That's simple. Try to be happy, try not to hurt other people, and hope to fall in love.
Jennifer... I've witnessed the one state that has no capital. So you see, it's the responsibility of every American to look after Ireland.
